website_summaries.verdict: An attractive date stamp that has limited appeal, but is a nice addition to your work area if you like its old-fashioned design.
pros: Designed with retro styling with wooden craftsmanship and a sturdy steel frame
Has a basic, easy-to-use design that include 10 years of dates
cons: If you prefer modern office equipment, this date stamp's vintage design probably isn't for you
Changing ink bands can be messy

customer_reviews.title: The millennials don't understand pricing
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the single digit rubber band is loose while the other bands are fine. For the cost, I am really happy. It's a wood and metal design which is nicer to look at than a bunch of plastic for a VERY good price. Perhaps people should look at the prices of things from the 1920's instead of always wanting things for free.
customer_reviews.author: j_222

customer_reviews.title: Humm
customer_reviews.text: Could’ve been worst really but the last two number bands were mixed up...so I’m still try to see if I can undo the metal part but so far nothing is happening. An easy fix some would say and returning is an option but we’ll see....
customer_reviews.author: maiyheart

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Not the most well-made product but good enough. Love the vintage look and it’s quite small and very cute. Nice design and holds well with fingers when stamping. Imprints are good and works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sovanny

customer_reviews.title: Nice date stamp
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for adding dates to my stamping projects. Love the retro look of both the stamped image and the stamp/stand. Stand works great.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Marie

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not for daily use
customer_reviews.text: It is not sturdy for frequent use. The month and date belts slip a little side-to-side but it works. The rotating wheels to adjust month and date are very thin plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sgo4th

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad little thing. I didn’t like the number four on it so I gave to coworker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like the picture!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute! Brings me back to the old paper library card days! Very good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Christmas Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Retro! Love it
customer_reviews.text: My son stamps all his homework with it. Lost of compliments on it. Very retro.
customer_reviews.author: Xtefani

customer_reviews.title: Great stamper.
customer_reviews.text: Good stamper so far. I use it to date my kids art.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Crooked numbers
customer_reviews.text: I mean, you get what you pay for. This isn't a great stamp for professional use. The rubber track is too loose on the wheels and risks coming off. The alignment of numbers is crooked and unless you press firmly, they come out illegible. If you're interested in buying this for aesthetic reasons and for personal use, it should work fine. I like the little stand it comes with. Pretty cute. I wouldn't buy this again though because I need it for more professional purposes. I'll be needing to buy a new stamp and keep this one because it's too much of a hassle to try to return.
customer_reviews.author: Twin

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt stamp full date
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't stamp evenly. Tried many times and have to keep re-stamping to get a good stamped date. Going to return this. I can write faster than stamp since parts of the date is always missing.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this is poorly made. Adjusting each section on the small rollers makes me nerveous because the rubber does not seem sturdy. And the numbers dont lay flat against the paper so you have to stamp and gently roll to get a complete date.
customer_reviews.author: Suelovelee

customer_reviews.title: Cute but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Really cute sitting on my desk and it's a stamp so not much to expect. The base is just a novelty. It's so light that everytime I pick up the stamp up the base comes with it. I would love the years to be customizable but it is what it is. It's worth the price I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Ziiola Shwelone

customer_reviews.title: Great look, stamps great.
customer_reviews.text: Cutest stamp. It stamps the date to my liking and it fits in my craft collection perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Stamp of disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Cute but the base isn’t very stable and the stamp isn’t well made
customer_reviews.author: CrimsonCrow

customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect! Just note that it doesn’t come with ink
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great little stamp. Easy to use. I like the wood base design.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Nice stamp
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful stamp, and easy to use. My only issue is the numbers do come out crooked if you do not pay very close attention when switching out dates.
customer_reviews.author: Lawson Kobayashi

product_meta.title: D-worthy Retro Wooden Handle & Base Roller Date Stamp, Rubber Stamp for DIY Craft Card Making Planner Scrapbooking (Brown)
feature_bullets: Made of wood handle and base, rubber band and steel frame
Easy to find the corresponding date and re-ink (ink is not included)
Good stamps to DIY photo album, scrapbook, keep a diary, or others DIY craft
